mainmatter.p: Let L be a small-complete and large and locally small lattice with a small intensional basis. If L is small-cocomplete then it is also small-complete.

p.block:
Proof. Denote by (B, \beta ) the small basis of L. Let (I, \iota ) be a \mathcal{U}-small family. We need to show that it has a greatest lower bound. Consider the family of lowerbounds for (I, \iota ): \mathfrak{L} _ \iota \vcentcolon \equiv \left ( \left ( \sum _{ b \ : \ B } \prod _{ i : I } \beta (b) \le \iota (i) \right ), \beta \circ \mathsf{pr} _1 \right ), which is a small family. We claim that the join \bigvee \mathfrak{L} _ \iota is the greatest lower bound of (I, \iota ).
First, notice that it is obviously a lower bound because for any i : I, \left ( \bigvee \mathfrak{L} _ \iota \right ) \le \iota (i) since \iota (i) is an upper bound of \mathfrak{L} _ \iota by construction.
Let l be a lower bound of (I, \iota ). By the assumption that (B, \beta ) is a basis for L, we know that there exists a family (J_l, \gamma _l) such that l = \bigvee _{j : J_l} \beta ( \gamma _l(j)). Therefore, it suffices to show \bigvee _{j : J_l} \beta ( \gamma _l(j)) \le \bigvee \mathfrak{L} _ \iota . For any j : J_l, the element \beta ( \gamma _l(j)) clearly falls in \mathfrak{L} _j itself since \beta ( \gamma _l(j)) \le l

mainmatter.p: Let D be a \mathcal{V}-dcpo. An intensional basis for D is a \mathcal{V}-family (B, \beta ) on D satisfying the condition: for every element x : D, there is a specified directed \mathcal{V}-family (I_x, \iota _x) on the basis index B such that x = \bigvee (I_x, \beta \circ \iota _x).
